subject: Power & Utilities: Weekly Update
body: Power prices moved significantly this week with grid capex trends shifting across the PJM and ERCOT regions. Transmission investment plans increased by 15% YoY. Utility rate cases remain a watch item with regulatory approvals pending in three key jurisdictions. Natural gas storage levels are above historical averages which may pressure power pricing in Q1. Key takeaway: Grid modernization investments are accelerating faster than expected.

subject: EV Supply Chain Note
body: Battery inputs saw volatility this quarter with lithium prices declining 8% month-over-month while nickel remained stable. OEM guidance changed for Tesla and Rivian with production targets being revised downward due to supply chain constraints. Charging infrastructure utilization metrics improved to 24% average across Level 3 chargers. European EV penetration hit 18% of new car sales, up from 15% last quarter. Watch: Battery recycling capacity announcements from key players.

subject: Intro + meeting next week
body: Hi team, we'd like to meet regarding your Fund II strategy and understand your approach to energy transition investments. Our allocation committee is particularly interested in how you're thinking about power infrastructure and renewable energy opportunities. We have $200M to deploy in 2024 across 3-4 managers. Would next Tuesday or Wednesday work for a call?

subject: Q4 Fundraising Update
body: Private markets fundraising sentiment improved in Q4 with energy transition funds seeing increased LP interest. Infrastructure and credit funds focused on essential assets raised $45B globally. Your peer group (mid-market credit) saw median fund size of $850M with first closes averaging 65% of target. Time to final close averaged 14 months, down from 18 months in 2023.

subject: Covenant Compliance Report
body: Attached is our Q4 2024 covenant compliance certificate. All financial covenants are in compliance: Debt/EBITDA at 4.2x (threshold 5.0x), Fixed Charge Coverage at 1.4x (threshold 1.25x), and minimum liquidity at $15M (threshold $10M). We anticipate covenant headroom to tighten in Q1 due to seasonal working capital needs but expect to remain compliant.
